intro: Gouldia st-johnii var. munroi, commonly known as the red-flowered gouldia, is a striking ornamental plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and showy, red or pink bracted inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for gardeners seeking drought-tolerant, low-maintenance plants.
